items.preText: 11.59am Right then. All set for the start. And spin straightaway in Mehedy Hasan Miraz. Jonathan : "Like how Shehan Madushanka comes in at the final! Hopefully, he can surprise the Bangledeshi batting lineup with his general pace! All the best to him on his debut! Hope he can deliver!" 11.50am Shere Bangla Stadium hasn't been a happy hunting ground in tournament finals for the home team. Bangladesh have lost three finals at this venue. Mashrafe Mortaza now wants to set the record straight and ease the painful memories. Chamara Perera: "Wow!!! What a moment for madhusanka debut on a final" Mizan Rahman: "I believe bangladesh will be definitely come back well and win this final today. But it will very excited game. Score will go 300 to between 330. I hope bating first will be winner. Thanks Mizan Reno USA " du Keman: "Hopefully tonight will not be a short one as two days' back. Looking forward to a keenly fought battle." Right then. Here are the teams. Bangladesh have rung in the changes. Anamul Haque, Nasir Hossain and Abul Hasan are out; Mohammad Mithun, Saifuddin and Mehidy are in. Bangladesh XI: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Mohammad Mithun, 3 Shakib Al Hasan, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Mahmudullah, 6 Sabbir Rahman, 7 Mohammad Saifuddin, 8 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Mustafizur Rahman, 11 Rubel Hossain One change for Sri Lanka: Shehan Madushanka replaces Lakshan Sandakan. International debut for Shehan Madhushanka. Sri Lanka XI: 1 Upul Tharanga, 2 Danushka Gunathilaka, 3 Kusal Mendis, 4 Dinesh Chandimal (capt), 5 Niroshan Dickwella (wk), 6 Asela Gunaratne, 7 Thisara Perera, 8 Akila Dananjaya, 9 Suranga Lakmal, 10 Dushmantha Chameera, 11 Shehan Madushanka Shaon: "Shakib goes to SRH for 2 crore inr." You can follow it live here. 11.35am Sri Lanka have won the toss and are batting first. Teams coming up shortly. 11.32am A couple of wins, some newfound confidence, and a bright new start under a new coach. Sri Lanka have moved in the right direction under him, and rightly, they have pinned their faith in Chandika Hathurusingha. 11.12am Thisara Perera. Tamim Iqbal. Suranga Lakmal. Shakib Al Hasan. What's common among these players? They're all on the big list and will go under the hammer a few thousand miles across in the subcontinent. And while one eye would undoubtedly be on the IPL auction, more immediately they will turn out for their respective national teams at the Shere Bangla Stadium. Hello, and welcome to the tri-series final in Mirpur. This has been a back and forth tournament. Bangladesh have dominated most of it. Sri Lanka were underwhelming in the first half and the potential of conceding a final spot to Zimbabwe was very much a possibility. But they have bounced back emphatically with two massive wins. Even so, heavens know which Sri Lanka will turn up today. They have been in quite the Pakistan mould, showing unpredictable flashes of brilliance, and at other times, crumbling listlessly in a heap. What that means is that now we are left with no actual favourite for the game. This has been a series dominated by the quicker guys, and Bangladesh undoubtedly boast the better pace attack. But Sri Lanka have the tools to counter that. If they can turn out at their best working condition, we should be in for a riveting final. More about what you need to look ahead to in Andrew Fernando's preview as we wait for the toss and teams.
items.text: a shortish loosener from the offspinner, turns away to give him room, Gunathilaka rocks back and flays a cut through the covers

items.text: brilliant follow-up. Rips away from a good length around off-stump and beats him on the front foot

items.text: fuller this time and curves in towards off, presses forward and pushes it out into the off side
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Gunathilaka, no run

items.text: too close to cut, shortish and he backs away to force the shot but gets beaten
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Gunathilaka, no run

items.text: floated up on off, driven down to log-off

items.preText: Mashrafe brings himself on from the other end.
items.text: short of a length, pitches outside leg, tucked to midwicket for one

items.text: back of a length on middle and leg, defended into the covers off the front foot

items.text: short of a length,nips away from him, gets slightly squared up as he loosely hangs his bat out without moving his feet and gets beaten

items.text: short of good length on the fifth-stump channel, drops into the off side off the backfoot
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Tharanga, no run

items.text: full and curving in on middle and leg, driven to long-off off the front foot
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Tharanga, 1 run

items.text: good length, spinning away from well outside off, defended off the front foot with an open face towards point
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Gunathilaka, no run

items.text: rips past the edge! He is caught on neither foot and it turns just enough from a fuller length
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Gunathilaka, no run

items.text: backs away but doesn't pick the arm ball that slides into him at pace, he chops it into the surface and is lucky it doesn't hit the stumps
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Gunathilaka, no run

items.text: and Bangladesh have their first breakthrough. And it arrives via a gift. Poor, poor shot early in the innings from Gunathilaka. Clears the front leg and tries to loft this fuller ball straight over. But it's a bit too full and he can't get underneath that entirely. Knocks it high into the air and long-off runs to his left to snaffle it
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Gunathilaka, OUT

dismissal.text: MD Gunathilaka c Tamim Iqbal b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 6 (11b 1x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

items.text: shortish, a little width, slapped to point
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Tharanga, no run

items.preText: Zeeshan Mahmud: "Watching Miraz is like solving a chess problem. OUT! as I write."
items.text: short and wide, opens up for a well-timed punch through the extra cover region
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Mendis, FOUR runs

items.text: cuts in from a good length towards off, stays in the crease and defends towards mid-on
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Mendis, no run

items.text: short of a length, gets on top from the confines of his crease and turns it away to midwicket for a very quick single. Direct hit, and it would have been a lot closer
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Mendis, 1 run

items.text: short of good length, pitches outside leg and climbs onto him unexpectedly to strike him on the back glove. Shades of Johannesburg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Tharanga, no run

items.text: short of a length, pitches outside leg and arrives around a fourth-stump channel, punched solidly into the off side
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Tharanga, no run

items.text: variable bounce again. Keeps low from a back of a length, forcing him to make a late adjustment as he turns it away to backward square leg
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Tharanga, no run

items.text: slightly flatter trajectory but he's picked the length early.It's pretty full and he gets down on one knee and carves it away over deep midwicket
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Mendis, SIX runs
